nodes.label: [TA2-7-2-1] projected ice conditions
nodes.definition: projected ice conditions

nodes.label: [TA2-7-3] route planning with awareness of iceberg risk
[TA2-7-3-1] seasonal forecasts of iceberg relevant indicators
nodes.definition: estimating the risk of icebergs with iceberg drifting models based on histrical data and seasonal forecast of sea and air temperature, wind and currents

nodes.label: [TA2-8] Tourism
nodes.definition: Tourism is a highly diverse user group that includes intermediaries (such as consultancy companies or environment agencies), businesses (such as tour operators or investors in tourist infrastructure and services), destination managers, tourist associations and policy makers, as well as tourists, The warming climate has the potential to significantly affect the appeal of tourist destinations. Working with experts we provide indicators able to inform personal and business decisions on seasonal and multi-decadal time-scales.

nodes.label: [TA2-8-1] facilitating ongoing and long-term adaptation of the tourism sector to a changing climate
[TA2-8-1-1] tourism-relevant climate indicators
nodes.definition: critical pan-European climate indicators (snow conditions, Holiday Climate Index, coastal waters data, lake temperature, forest fires index), examples of indicators are: Mountain Tourism Meteorological and Snow Indicators (MTMSI) – Past conditions and long-term future projections, Holiday Climate Index (HCI) – Seasonal forecasts and long-term future projections, Fire Weather Index (FWI) – Seasonal forecasts and long-term future projections, Lake Water Surface Temperature (LWST) – Seasonal forecasts

nodes.label: [TA2-8-2] long-term planning for winter tourism in mountainous regions
nodes.definition: mountain tourism activities, in particular operating conditions of ski resorts

nodes.label: [TA2-8-2-1] past conditions and future projections of snow season duration
nodes.definition: This includes, for example, past and future temperature and natural and managed (including effects of grooming and snowmaking) snow season duration, as a function of altitude.

nodes.label: [TA2-8-2-1-1] Mountain Tourism Meteorological and Snow Indicators (MTMSI)
[TA2-9] Biodiversity
nodes.definition: nature conservation agencies, policy makers, plantation owners, scientists and private companies in the biodiversity sector use EO information in their combat against biodiversity loss by planning and monitoring ecosystem restoration and species dispersion measures

nodes.label: [TA2-9-1] assessing biodiversity and ecoystem services
nodes.definition: biodiversity and ecosystem service assessments for both fauna and flora, in the terrestrial as well as the marine biosphere, for different climatic zones around the globe

nodes.label: [TA2-9-1-1] climate-biodiversity indicators
nodes.definition: assessing the impact of temperature, rainfall, and other atmospheric, terrestrial or oceanic variables on habitat suitability, species distribution, species fitness and reproduction, and ecosystem services

nodes.label: [TA2-10] Global users
nodes.definition: to facilitate climate adaptation worldwide

nodes.label: [TA3] Land Monitoring
nodes.definition: user interested in Earth's land surface

nodes.label: [TA3-1] Vegetation
nodes.definition: to monitor the changes on continental biomass

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1] to monitor the changes on continental biomass
nodes.definition: to monitor the changes on continental biomass

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1-1] burnt area mapping
nodes.definition: to classify burnt areas after fires based on vegetation change

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1-2] Dry Matter Productivity
nodes.definition: to define the growth rate or dry biomass increase of vegetation

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1-3] Vegetation Status/ Health
nodes.definition: to explore the status and variety of vegetation

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1-3-1] Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation (FAPAR)
nodes.definition: to calculate the fraction of solar radiation absorbed by live leaves

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1-3-2] Fraction of green Vegetation Cover (FCOVER)
nodes.definition: to model the fraction of ground covered by green

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1-3-3] Vegetation indices
nodes.definition: to define vegetation status, type, and health based on different indices

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1-1-1] Leaf Area Index
nodes.definition: to define as half the area of green elements of the canopy per unit horizontal ground area

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1-1-2] NDVI
nodes.definition: to calculate as an indicator for greenness and biomass

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1-1-3] Vegetation Condition Index (VCI)
nodes.definition: to determine the difference between the current NDVi and values observed in the same period in previous years

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1-1-4] Vegetation Productivity Index (VPI)
nodes.definition: to assess the overall vegetation condition by referencing the current value of the NDVI with the long-term statistics from the same period

nodes.label: [TA3-1-1-4] Land Cover
nodes.definition: to define different classes of physical coverage of the Earth's surface

nodes.label: [TA3-1-2] to monitor the status of water contained in the soil
nodes.definition: to quantify parameters such as soil water indices or the surface soil moisture

nodes.label: [TA3-1-2-1] Soil Water Indices
nodes.definition: to quantify the soil moisture based on available indices

nodes.label: [TA3-1-2-1-1] Soil Water Index
nodes.definition: to quantify the moisture condition at variuos depths in the soil

nodes.label: [TA3-1-2-2] Surface Soil Moisture
nodes.definition: to define the relative water content of the top few centimetres soil, describing how wet or dry the soil is in its topmost layer, expressed in percent saturation

nodes.label: [TA3-2] Energy
nodes.definition: user interested in modeling the incoming solar radiation controls

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1] to model solar radiation controls
nodes.definition: user group interested in solar radiation

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1-1] Land Surface Temperature
nodes.definition: to determine the radiative skin temperature of the land surface

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1-2] Surface Albedo
nodes.definition: to define the fraction of sunlight reflected by the surface of the Earth

nodes.label: [TA3-2-1-3] Top Of Canopy Reflectances
nodes.definition: to model the fraction of the sunlight reflected by the surface of the Earth in a given spectral band

nodes.label: [TA3-3] Water
nodes.definition: users interested in water bodies

nodes.label: [TA3-3-1] to explore the earth's water
nodes.definition: to explore the earth's water as a key element

nodes.label: [TA3-3-1-1] Lake Surface Water Temperature
nodes.definition: to determine the temperature of the lake surface influencing the lake hydrology and biogeochemistry

nodes.label: [TA3-3-1-1-2] Laker Water Quality
nodes.definition: to monitor the quality in lakes and reservoirs

nodes.label: [TA3-3-1-1-3] Water Bodies
nodes.definition: to detect the area covered by inland water providing minimum and maximum extent along the year

nodes.label: [TA3-3-1-1-4] Water Level
nodes.definition: to determine the water level as the height of the reflecting surface of continental water bodies

nodes.label: [TA3-4] Cryosphere
nodes.definition: users interested in snow and ice

nodes.label: [TA3-4-1] to explore the Earth's snow cover
nodes.definition: to explore the Earth's snow cover and its influence on various systems

nodes.label: [TA3-4-1-1] Lake Ice Extent
nodes.definition: to classify ice for freshwater bodies into fully snow covered ice, partially snow covered ice and open water

nodes.label: [TA3-4-1-2] Snow Cover Extent
nodes.definition: to provide information on the snow cover extent incluenced by temerature changes and precipitation

nodes.label: [TA3-4-1-3] Snow Water Equivalent
nodes.definition: to explore the equivalent amount of liquid water stored in the snow pack

nodes.label: [TA3-5] Hot Spots Monitoring
nodes.definition: users interested in mapping and analysing specific hotspots in regard to the change in land cover over time

nodes.label: [TA3-5-1] to detect change over time
nodes.definition: to detect the change over time

nodes.label: [TA3-5-1-1] Land Cover Change
nodes.definition: to detect the change in land cover based imagery acquired on multiple time steps

nodes.label: [TA3-6] Groundbased Observations
nodes.definition: to provide in situ-measurements

nodes.label: [TA4-1] Marine Resources
nodes.definition: to monitor resources in marine context

nodes.label: [TA4-1-1] support sustainable management of marine resources
[TA4-2] Maritime Safety
nodes.definition: to manage maritime safety by providing supporting services

nodes.label: [TA4-3] Coastal and marine environment
nodes.definition: monitoring the coastal and marine environment by using monitoring indictaors such as ocean health, heat content, sea level, sea ice, climate variability, water mass and heat exchange or temperature and salinity

nodes.label: [TA4-3-1] support coastal management
nodes.definition: support coastal management

nodes.label: [TA4-3-2] support environmental impact assessment
nodes.definition: support environmental impact assessment

nodes.label: [TA4-4-1] reporting on the state of the ocean
nodes.definition: reporting on the state of the ocean

nodes.label: [TA5-1] Border Surveillance
nodes.definition: to manage external borders

nodes.label: [TA5-1-1] discover border surveillance at land
nodes.definition: to manage external borders from land perspective

nodes.label: [TA5-1-2] discover border surveillance at sea
nodes.definition: to manage external borders from sea perspective

nodes.label: [TA5-2] Maritime Surveillance
nodes.definition: has a strong connection to the marine monitoring domain

nodes.label: [TA5-2-1] to surveil the safety of navigation
nodes.definition: to provide safety of navigation at sea

nodes.label: [TA5-2-2] to control fisheries
nodes.definition: to monitor fishery activities

nodes.label: [TA5-2-3] to monitor marine pollution
nodes.definition: to monitor marine pollution based on a number of parameters and methods

nodes.label: [TA5-2-4] law enforcement at sea
nodes.definition: to provide law enforcement at sea

nodes.label: [TA5-3] Support to EU External Action
nodes.definition: user group to assist in crisis situations

nodes.label: [TA5-3-1] to support peacekeeping operations
nodes.definition: to assist in situations of crisis or emerging crisis

nodes.label: [TA5-3-2] to support conflict prevention
nodes.definition: using Earth observation methodology for conflict prevention and monitoring of conflict situations

nodes.label: [TA5-3-3] to conduct risk assessments
nodes.definition: to provide risk assessments to supprt external action

nodes.label: [TA6] Emergency
nodes.definition: user groups interested in using Earth observation methodology to prevent, monitor and support actions after emergencies, such as natural disasters

nodes.label: [TA6-1] Emergency Mapping
nodes.definition: Rapid mapping for emergency action… for…. Volcanic Activity, Storm, Extreme temperature, Flood, Mass movement, Drought, Wildfire, Epidemic, Infestation, Industrial Accident, Transport Accident, Humanitarian

nodes.label: [TA6-1-1] Disaster extent
nodes.definition: First Estimate Product, Delineation products

nodes.label: [TA6-1-2] Damage Assessment
nodes.definition: Grading products

nodes.label: [TA6-1-3] Reference information
nodes.definition: Reference Products

nodes.label: [TA6-2] Risk & Recovery mapping
nodes.definition: user group interested in risk and recovery procedures in context of emergency, such as natural disaster risk

nodes.label: [TA6-2-1] Risk mapping
nodes.definition: Reference maps

nodes.label: [TA6-2-2] Vulnerability assessment
nodes.definition: Pre-disaster situation maps, Post-disaster situation maps

nodes.label: [TA6-3] Alert & Early Warning
nodes.definition: Enabling preparation for emergency situation

nodes.label: [TA6-3-1] Early warning for emergency situation
nodes.definition: Examples: Floods/EFAS, Fires/EFFIS, Drought/DO

nodes.label: [TA7-1] EO Communities
nodes.definition: EARSC, GEO, etc.

nodes.label: [TA7-2] Globally active space agencies operating EO satellites and history of EO
nodes.definition: USA - UDSSR space race and beginnings of satellite-based Earth observation

nodes.label: [TA7-3] Vision and mission of EO and RS
[TA7-4] Image processing (value) chain
nodes.definition: generic workflow that EO information production relies on

nodes.label: [TA7-5-2] Copernicus Programme
nodes.definition: Entrusted Entities (EE) include ECMWF (https://www.ecmwf.int/en/about)

nodes.label: [PS3-6] Data Formats
nodes.definition: Remote Sensing data formats in which the data are organized and stored.

nodes.label: [PS3-6-1] Digital OrthophotoQuadrangle DOQ
nodes.definition: A computer-generated image of an aerial photograph in which the image displacement caused by terrain relief and camera tilt has been removed.

learning_outcomes.name: http://www.bigknowledge.net/ontos/gin2k#AM10-1-1
learning_outcomes.label: Describe emerging geographical analysis techniques in geocomputation derived from artificial intelligence e.g., expert systems, artificial neural networks, genetic algorithms, and software agents
learning_outcomes.definition: Describe emerging geographical analysis techniques in geocomputation derived from artificial intelligence e.g., expert systems, artificial neural networks, genetic algorithms, and software agents

learning_outcomes.name: http://www.bigknowledge.net/ontos/gin2k#AM10-1-2
learning_outcomes.label: Describe difficulties in dealing with large spatial databases, especially those arising from spatial heterogeneity
learning_outcomes.definition: Describe difficulties in dealing with large spatial databases, especially those arising from spatial heterogeneity

learning_outcomes.name: http://www.bigknowledge.net/ontos/gin2k#AM10-1-3
learning_outcomes.label: Explain what is meant by the term contaminated data, suggesting how it can arise
learning_outcomes.definition: Explain what is meant by the term contaminated data, suggesting how it can arise

learning_outcomes.name: http://www.bigknowledge.net/ontos/gin2k#AM10-1-4
